Claim: Did genetic mutations cause the coronavirus to become more dangerous.
Explaination: Infectious disease specialist said no proof that mutation specifically caused virus to be more dangerous.
Label: Partially true
html:
Claim: Did genetic mutations cause the coronavirus to become more dangerous.

Explanation:Infectious disease specialist said no proof that mutation specifically caused virus to be more dangerous.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/Fact-Check-NO-Proof-That-Genetic-Mutations-Responsible-For-Coronavirus's-Virulence.html

Claim: All fruit and vegetable markets in the Indian city of Chennai and across the state of Tamil Nadu have been ordered to close in an effort to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; Chennai’s municipal authority called the social media posts “fake”, and Tamil Nadu’s chief minister said that stores selling “essential items” such as groceries are allowed to operate as normal despite a nationwide lockdown.
Label: False
html:
Claim: All fruit and vegetable markets in the Indian city of Chennai and across the state of Tamil Nadu have been ordered to close in an effort to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; Chennai’s municipal authority called the social media posts “fake”, and Tamil Nadu’s chief minister said that stores selling “essential items” such as groceries are allowed to operate as normal despite a nationwide lockdown.

https://factcheck.afp.com/indian-authorities-refute-fake-claim-about-food-markets-closing-chennai-during-covid-19-lockdown

Claim: People in Wuhan are locked inside their houses by the Chinese government.
Explaination: The video is of people in wuhan offering their respects to the whistleblower, doctor Li Wenliang.
Label: False
html:
Claim: People in Wuhan are locked inside their houses by the Chinese government.

Explanation:The video is of people in wuhan offering their respects to the whistleblower, doctor Li Wenliang.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/wuhan-people-screaming-for-lives-fact-check/

Claim: President Barack Obama “waited six months to call swine flu an emergency after thousands died.”
Explaination: The Obama administration declared swine flu, or H1N1, a public health emergency six weeks before H1N1 was declared a pandemic. No H1N1 deaths had yet been recorded in the United States.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Barack Obama “waited six months to call swine flu an emergency after thousands died.”

Explanation:The Obama administration declared swine flu, or H1N1, a public health emergency six weeks before H1N1 was declared a pandemic. No H1N1 deaths had yet been recorded in the United States.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/04/facebook-posts/president-obama-declared-h1n1-public-health-emerge/

Claim: The army is patrolling all the streets, towns and villages in Ireland.
Explaination: New and unprecedented measures have been introduced to help curb the spread of the coronavirus, but the post false describes that those rules actually are. Police are patrolling parts of the country, but not all of it, and there are no plans at present for the army to patrol the streets.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: The army is patrolling all the streets, towns and villages in Ireland.

Explanation:New and unprecedented measures have been introduced to help curb the spread of the coronavirus, but the post false describes that those rules actually are. Police are patrolling parts of the country, but not all of it, and there are no plans at present for the army to patrol the streets.

https://jrnl.ie/5061925

Claim: China needs coronavirus SWAT (special weapons and tactics) police teams to arrest this coronavirus victim.
Explaination: Video shows a mock drill by Tongbai police practicing to take down coronavirus infected patients in case they are uncooperative.
Label: False
html:
Claim: China needs coronavirus SWAT (special weapons and tactics) police teams to arrest this coronavirus victim.

Explanation:Video shows a mock drill by Tongbai police practicing to take down coronavirus infected patients in case they are uncooperative.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/02/25/chinese-police-forcefully-detaining-coronavirus-patients-on-the-highway/

Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”
Explaination: The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”

Explanation:The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/07/charlie-kirk/china-spying-you-through-zoom-charlie-kirk-oversta/

Claim: Queen Elizabeth said Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte “is the kind of leader who knows the way … Filipinos are very lucky to have him.”
Explaination: Queen Elizabeth delivered a speech addressing the coronavirus on April 5, but she didn't mention President Rodrigo Duterte.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Queen Elizabeth said Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte “is the kind of leader who knows the way … Filipinos are very lucky to have him.”

Explanation:Queen Elizabeth delivered a speech addressing the coronavirus on April 5, but she didn't mention President Rodrigo Duterte.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/07/viral-image/no-queen-elizabeth-didnt-praise-philippine-preside/

Claim: Hindu man in Rajasthan killed by Muslims amidst lockdown.
Explaination: The video is originally from Pakistan where a man was maimed by his wife's relatives.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Hindu man in Rajasthan killed by Muslims amidst lockdown.

Explanation:The video is originally from Pakistan where a man was maimed by his wife's relatives.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-hindu-man-killed-by-muslims-in-rajasthan/

Claim: A video of dozens of people praying outdoors shows Italians praying during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; the footage in fact shows a prayer event in Peru in December 2019, weeks before Italy reported its first case of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video of dozens of people praying outdoors shows Italians praying during the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; the footage in fact shows a prayer event in Peru in December 2019, weeks before Italy reported its first case of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-actually-shows-worshippers-peru-2019-covid-19-pandemic

Claim: The novel coronavirus “will not spread” in the Philippines due to the country’s high temperature and relatively high humidity.
Explaination: In an email response to this claim, the World Health Organization (WHO) told Rappler that 2019-nCoV "has spread to countries with both hot and humid climates, as well as cold and dry."
Label: False
html:
Claim: The novel coronavirus “will not spread” in the Philippines due to the country’s high temperature and relatively high humidity.

Explanation:In an email response to this claim, the World Health Organization (WHO) told Rappler that 2019-nCoV "has spread to countries with both hot and humid climates, as well as cold and dry."

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/251554-novel-coronavirus-will-not-spread-philippines-due-high-temperature-humidity

Claim: A poem about people self-isolating at home has been shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter in April 2020 alongside a claim that it was written in the 19th century and reprinted during the 1918 Spanish flu pandemic. The posts, published as the world continued to endure the spread of the novel coronavirus, claim the poem is evidence that “history repeats itself.”
Explaination: The claim is false; the poem was first published online in March 2020 by a retired teacher in the US during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A poem about people self-isolating at home has been shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter in April 2020 alongside a claim that it was written in the 19th century and reprinted during the 1918 Spanish flu pandemic. The posts, published as the world continued to endure the spread of the novel coronavirus, claim the poem is evidence that “history repeats itself.”

Explanation:The claim is false; the poem was first published online in March 2020 by a retired teacher in the US during the novel coronavirus pandemic.

https://factcheck.afp.com/poem-was-written-2020-specifically-about-covid-19-pandemic

Claim: Audio claiming India would be put under a complete lockdown.
Explaination: The government rubbished claims of there being such a lockdown.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Audio claiming India would be put under a complete lockdown.

Explanation:The government rubbished claims of there being such a lockdown.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/pib-rubbishes-viral-whatsapp-audio-clip-claiming-india-will-go-into-a-lockdown-7230

Claim: Video says President Donald Trump spawned the “Wuhan super virus outbreak under code name ‘zyphr.’”
Explaination: There’s no evidence that President Trump had anything to do with the creation of the coronavirus.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Video says President Donald Trump spawned the “Wuhan super virus outbreak under code name ‘zyphr.’”

Explanation:There’s no evidence that President Trump had anything to do with the creation of the coronavirus.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/03/youtube-videos/no-trump-did-not-create-coronavirus/

Claim: A Chinese person, who was taken from Kansai airport (in Osaka, Japan) to a hospital, has run away before they could be tested.
Explaination: According to the Kansai Airport Quarantine Station, this information is absolutely false.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A Chinese person, who was taken from Kansai airport (in Osaka, Japan) to a hospital, has run away before they could be tested.

Explanation:According to the Kansai Airport Quarantine Station, this information is absolutely false.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/kotahatachi/unknown-cause-china

Claim: “COVID literally stands for Chinese Originated Viral Infectious Disease.”
Explaination: COVID-19 is an abbreviation of “coronavirus disease 2019.” “CO” stands for “corona,” “VI” stands for “virus” and “D” stands for “disease.” The number 19 reflects the year the disease was identified — 2019.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: “COVID literally stands for Chinese Originated Viral Infectious Disease.”

Explanation:COVID-19 is an abbreviation of “coronavirus disease 2019.” “CO” stands for “corona,” “VI” stands for “virus” and “D” stands for “disease.” The number 19 reflects the year the disease was identified — 2019.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/30/viral-image/covid-stands-coronavirus-disease-2019/

Claim: Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo says bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo says bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.

https://factcheck.afp.com/graphic-purported-quote-philippine-vice-president-leni-robredo-has-been-doctored?check=1

Claim: A Facebook post asserts the U.S. developed a COVID-19 vaccine to release this Sunday.
Explaination: Currently, there are still no definitive and institutionalised vaccines for COVID-19; nonetheless, research persists and holds potential solutions.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A Facebook post asserts the U.S. developed a COVID-19 vaccine to release this Sunday.

Explanation:Currently, there are still no definitive and institutionalised vaccines for COVID-19; nonetheless, research persists and holds potential solutions.

https://dubawa.org/covid-19-still-without-a-definite-cure-amid-clinical-trials/

Claim: High death rate in Italy is due to people taking Ibuprofen.
Explaination: Both universities cited as the source termed it fake news, while the WHO has said there isn't enough evidence against using ibuprofen in the treatment of COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: High death rate in Italy is due to people taking Ibuprofen.

Explanation:Both universities cited as the source termed it fake news, while the WHO has said there isn't enough evidence against using ibuprofen in the treatment of COVID-19.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/no-evidence-ibuprofen-makes-covid-19-worse-say-experts/

Claim: Pier Luigi Bersani: None of the confirmed cases are related to China. Coronavirus might have occured in Italy before China.
Explaination: In the interview, Bersani didn't say that the virus is originated from Italy. In contrast, he emphasized that the virus is from China. His point is to bring up the assumption that the virus came to Italy prior to the time WHO declared the emergency.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Pier Luigi Bersani: None of the confirmed cases are related to China. Coronavirus might have occured in Italy before China.

Explanation:In the interview, Bersani didn't say that the virus is originated from Italy. In contrast, he emphasized that the virus is from China. His point is to bring up the assumption that the virus came to Italy prior to the time WHO declared the emergency.

https://tfc-taiwan.org.tw/articles/2941

Claim: Cattle vaccine is related to COVID-19, the current panic overblown by media.
Explaination: The viral post claims that the world has been using coronavirus vaccine on cattle for years and the current panic on novel coronavirus (COVID-19) has been overblown by media. When we investigated, we found that the vaccine being referred is for cattle, it is neither related with humans, not with COVID-19. The viral post is misleading.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Cattle vaccine is related to COVID-19, the current panic overblown by media.

Explanation:The viral post claims that the world has been using coronavirus vaccine on cattle for years and the current panic on novel coronavirus (COVID-19) has been overblown by media. When we investigated, we found that the vaccine being referred is for cattle, it is neither related with humans, not with COVID-19. The viral post is misleading.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-cattle-vaccine-not-related-to-covid-19-misleading-post-getting-viral/

Claim: People are still shopping in malls in spite of the curfew and mobility restrictions in Ecuador.
Explaination: The date doesn't match the images. It was taken before march 22nd.
Label: False
html:
Claim: People are still shopping in malls in spite of the curfew and mobility restrictions in Ecuador.

Explanation:The date doesn't match the images. It was taken before march 22nd.

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/?fbclid=IwAR1LPZVARe1YjPhq3jijxwuSjIPKxv_9Io6BRDHJ2Cx45oaFHlhnm2_y5ZI?check=6

Claim: A photo of a man and woman embracing has been shared on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows two Italian doctors who died from COVID-19 after contracting the disease from the patients they treated.
Explaination: The claim is false; this is an Associated Press photo of a couple kissing at an airport in Barcelona, Spain.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo of a man and woman embracing has been shared on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows two Italian doctors who died from COVID-19 after contracting the disease from the patients they treated.

Explanation:The claim is false; this is an Associated Press photo of a couple kissing at an airport in Barcelona, Spain.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-has-circulated-reports-about-couple-airport-barcelona-march-2020?check=2

Claim: A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube which claim it shows Chinese police arresting people infected with the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video shows police arresting pro-democracy protesters at a subway station in Hong Kong in August 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube which claim it shows Chinese police arresting people infected with the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video shows police arresting pro-democracy protesters at a subway station in Hong Kong in August 2019.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-shows-police-officers-arresting-protesters-hong-kong-august-2019

Claim: President of Italy crying because of the coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: Firstly, the man in the picture, Jair Bolsonaro, is not the President of Italy but that of Brazil. Further, the image is not recent and was taken at the thanksgiving speech at the Palacio do Planalto in December 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President of Italy crying because of the coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:Firstly, the man in the picture, Jair Bolsonaro, is not the President of Italy but that of Brazil. Further, the image is not recent and was taken at the thanksgiving speech at the Palacio do Planalto in December 2019.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/italy-president-crying-coronavirus-deaths-fact-check
